title: Charles Schwab Up Nearly 6%, on Pace for Largest Percent Increase Since December 2018 — Data Talk
text:
Charles Schwab Corporation (SCHW) is currently at $39.88, up $2.16 or 5.73%

-- Would be highest close since Sept. 30, 2019, when it closed at $41.83

-- On pace for largest percent increase since Dec. 26, 2018, when it rose 6.04%

-- Earlier Tuesday, Charles Schwab Corp. reported a third-quarter profit of $951 million, or 70 cents a share. Analysts polled by FactSet were expecting earnings of 64 cents a share

-- Currently up five consecutive days; up 13.2% over this period

-- Longest winning streak since Sept. 13, 2019, when it rose for eight straight trading days

-- Best five day stretch since the five days ending Nov. 15, 2016, when it rose 14.78%

-- Down 4.66% month-to-date

-- Down 3.97% year-to-date

-- Down 33.08% from its all-time closing high of $59.59 on May 22, 2018

-- Traded as high as $39.97; highest intraday level since Sept. 30, 2019, when it hit $41.93

-- Up 5.97% at today's intraday high; largest intraday percent increase since Jan. 16, 2019, when it rose as much as 6.62%

-- Fifth best performer in the S&P 500 today

All data as of 11:24:40 AM

Source: Dow Jones Market Data, FactSet

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 15, 2019 11:45 ET (15:45 GMT)
